title.narrative: Emergency response to Syrian refugees in Lebanon

description.narrative: The project will address the needs of vulnerable refugee children from Syria to Lebanon, building on MSL'a existing work in 4 centres which provide education, social and psychosocial support to children and youth most at risk. The children targeted in this project are unregistered children in many regions who are either out of school or at risk of entering the labour market or being involved in conflict. The project works in an environment where conflict and deprivation are present, aiming to protect children from the harshest effects of the enviornment they are growing up in in, and from the effect of exodus and war.

This project encompasses 3 related components: Activity A.1: Identify and recruit 120 children at risk of being abused Based on the demands listed in each centre of unregistered refugees, the MSL team will reach families who formulated demands to enrol their children in the alternative schools. Activity A.2: Identify a range of options to achieve the identified learning needs of children and provide them with alternative education. In each target region, an educator will conduct an assessment on educational capacities and needs for each children. Each child will be assigned to a study group accordingly. As soon as the identification phase and the learning needs are recognized, Alternative classes will ensure to youth a daily accompaniment provided by experienced educators. Activity A.3: Provide children with psychological and social support along with awareness raising activities. Once per week and per centre, the psychologist will be available to ensure children’s well being. The specialist will also spot cases of exploitation or abuse which will be addressed separately. This activity will also encompass trainings on CRC, will gather an array of methods used and experienced by the MSL through previous projects.
